title: Lincolnshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: army vans to protect christmas light switch-on .
former red arrow pilot donates suit to children in need .
pain returns for children in need walkers .
red arrows 'could be built abroad ' warning .

documents.title: that 's all folks : five things we learned today
text: that 's it from us for the week , we 'll be back on monday with the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the county as it happens .
for now i 'll leave you with five things we 've learned today :
have a lovely weekend !
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: weather : a few showers overnight
text: it will be a dry and clear night at first although overnight cloud will tend to increase bringing a few showery outbreaks of rain later .
not as cold as last night with a minimum temperature of 4 deg c ( 39 deg f ) .
tomorrow will see showery outbreaks of rain which will move southwards through the morning , brightening from the north through the afternoon with sunny spells .
highs of 8 deg c ( 46 deg f ) .
and sunday will see a cold and frosty start but dry and fine throughout the day with plenty of sunshine but clouding over from the west later and feeling cold .
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: pudsey goes viking team surpass £ 10k target
text: over £ 11,000 has been raised for children in need after bbc radio lincolnshire 's breakfast team walked 147 miles through lincolnshire .
although blisters and injuries forced them to drop out halfway through the challenge , the team finished the trek with the help of bbc lincolnshire colleagues .
scott dalton , corazon garcia , and rob makepeace ( aimed to raise £ 10,000 for children in need , and have surpassed the target .
they 're above , tearfully accepting an £ 800 donation from the staff at north lincolnshire council when they arrived at the humber bridge .
and now , to round off their week of ups and downs , they 're turning on lincoln 's christmas lights .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: teen goes missing from holbeach
text: a 15-year-old vietnamese boy has gone missing from holbeach .
binh nguyen who is living in tidcote was last seen on wednesday at 12:00 in holbeach .
he was wearing black trousers , black jumper and a black jacket .
he is around 5'5 '' with short black hair and thin framed glasses .
binh is from vietnam and has very little english .
police are urging anyone who may have seen him to get in touch .

documents.title: army lorries arrive to protect christmas light switch-on
text: army lorries have arrived to block off pedestrian entrances to lincoln 's city centre , ahead of the christmas light switch on tonight .
the trucks are part of a drive to improve security after the increasing use of vehicles as weapons against pedestrians .
vehicles were driven by terrorists into crowds at a christmas market in germany last year , into crowds in nice in 2016 , and in the london bridge terror attack earlier this year .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: fire near wildlife park in horncastle
text: a fire , which has broken out at a scrapyard in horncastle , is close to a wildlife park .
firefighters have been tackling the fire since 14:30 this afternoon .
at its height five engines and a team of firefighters were tackling the blaze .
locals say the fire is under control and is no longer as fierce as it was at its peak .
lincs fire and rescue are telling the public to close their doors and windows .
the animals at the nearby wildlife park are n't thought to be at risk from the fire itself .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: disputed railway bridge approved
text: a bridge to cross over the railway on lincoln 's brayford wharf has been approved after an appeal by network rail .
the bridge ( artists impression above ) was originally rejected by the city of lincoln council because it did n't include plans for a lift to provide access for wheelchair users .
plans for a bridge over the crossing go back to 2013 , but network rail said it could n't afford to build a bridge with wheelchair access in 2015 .
network rail says it 's delighted the plans have been approved because it 's one of the `` highest risk level crossings in the region '' .
it previously said the bridge was necessary to discourage pedestrians from `` misusing the crossing and putting their lives at risk '' .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: stop motorists being 'ripped off ' by parking fines , says mp
text: there 's a growing problem across our area of private parking companies wrongly issuing tickets , according to mp sir greg knight .
he 's now leading a charge in parliament to stop motorists being `` ripped off '' .
the campaign is being welcomed by simone riley from lincoln ( who was fined after parking legally two years ago .
i came and parked in the car park , came back within the two hour slot you 're allowed for free parking and i 'd got a parking ticket , so obviously i was a bit confused by that .
it turns out that once they 'd sent the evidence through that they 'd changed the time stamp to an hour before i was here to make it look like i was here longer than i really was .
mp sir greg knight says he thinks some companies should lose their right to get the motorists ' info from the dvla .
there 's been a 28 % increase in the number of tickets issued this year compared with last year .
the international parking community , who represent the industry , says that the vast majority of parking companies issue fines fairly .
author: Jake Zuckerman
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: breakingfive fire engines at fire in horncastle
text: there are five fire engines and numerous firefighters tackling a blaze at a scrapyard in horncastle .
the fire service is advising people to keep their windows and doors closed if they 're in the area .
plumes of smoke can be seen from across the village , we 'll have more as soon as we get it .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: mp calls on government to do more to save bae jobs
text: there have been further calls in parliament to try and protect jobs at bae systems in brough by bringing forward orders for replacing the red arrows hawk jets .
bae systems has announced plans to cut almost 2,000 jobs across the uk , including 400 in brough .
the former labour defence minister , kevan jones , says he 's concerned new jets would have to be built abroad and that the future of the display team would be uncertain .
but defence minister , harriet baldwin , said the red arrows are n't at risk :

i can reassure the house that we are continuing to work on export opportunities in terms of kuwait and in terms of india and also that the raf has 28 of the t2 aircraft and that there is no risk to the red arrows . ''
author: Katy Austin
BBC Look North, Business Correspondent

documents.title: x-factor star 's dad fails in fraud appeal
text: the disgraced dad of x factor star ella henderson can now be sentenced after his fraud convictions were confirmed by appeal court judges .
sean patrick henderson , 51 , of tetney manor , tetney , lincolnshire , was accused of vat and investment frauds relating to his business dealings .
he has always denied any dishonesty , but was convicted of tax evasion and a fraud conspiracy at sheffield crown court after trials last year .
henderson has not yet been sentenced and today took his case to london 's appeal court , where top judges upheld the convictions .

documents.title: children in need team complete 147-mile walk
text: radio lincolnshire 's breakfast show team have completed their epic challenge for bbc children in need .
despite blisters , injuries , tears and a tag-team finish , scott dalton , corazon garcia and rob makepeace have crossed the finish line for their 147-mile journey .
the team intended to walk the whole of the viking way through lincolnshire but after injuries , the baton was passed on to other members of the radio lincolnshire team for a short time .
but just a few minutes ago , the original trio crossed the finish line .
if you want to donate to their cause , follow this link , they 're only a short way off their £ 10,000 target .
the @ twitterid team doing their thing for # bbccin # pudseygoesviking challenge complete !
more on @ twitterid later
really enjoying volunteering for @ twitterid who are supported by @ twitterid # communityradio for # basildonandeastthurrock we run # radioclub for children on saturday mornings
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: major new car park opens in lincoln
text: the first phase of lincoln 's new 1,000 space car park opens today , ahead of schedule .
the lincoln central car park on broadgate is part of a £ 30m investment into a `` transport hub '' in the city centre .
hundreds of spaces will be available from midday and it 's hoped the top floors will be ready in time for the lincoln christmas market .
it 's absolutely fantastic news for us and we really are getting pretty excited about it .
1,001 car parking spaces , a great christmas present to our city .

documents.title: new bridge to go ahead after appeal
text: new bridge to go ahead after appeal

documents.title: children in need in lincolnshire
text: there 's fundraising happening all across the county for children in need
we 've got our breakfast team walking an excessive number of miles , all for a good cause .
but what are you doing ?
send us your photos !

documents.title: 'incredible impact ' from children in need grant
text: a charity which benefits from children in need funding has spoken of the `` incredible impact '' the money has on the children it supports .
the south lincolnshire domestic abuse service helps families in south holland and boston who 've been affected by domestic abuse .
they 've been taking families out for special days out ( above , is a child 's thank you note to the charity ) to help them recover from a difficult home life .

marie chapman from the group says they find `` that these basic `` building blocks '' of family relationships are missing ; this has a devastating impact upon the development of children and young people , and their relationships with mothers too . ''
domestic abuse can , according to the charity , also have a huge effect on the early development of the children involved :
some of the most demonstrable evidence includes attention-seeking behaviour , poor vocabulary , poor levels of engagement , even abusive behaviour towards their mother
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: children take over lincoln castle
text: pull up the drawbridges and prepare the defences , because lincoln castle is being invaded
children from the ermine primary academy are taking over the running of the castle today for a national museum campaign .
the takeover is to help youngsters learn some history and have a bit of fun .
spare a thought for lorraine shaw , the pupils ' teacher , because they have keys to the castle 's dungeon
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: first joint fire and ambulance station to open
text: lincolnshire 's first joint fire and ambulance station has just been officially opened .
firefighters at louth 's eastfield road station are now working alongside east midlands ambulance service paramedics .
the new station has just been opened by louth 's mp , victoria atkins .
there was even a special cake ( above ) .
author: Seb Tiley
Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: buildings demolished in lincoln
text: buildings in lincoln 's west end are being pulled down to make way for a new block of flats .
take a look :
author: Lucy Parry
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: boston air cadets 'desperately ' in need of it funding
text: an air cadets group in boston says it is `` desperately '' in need of funding to help cadets sit their exams .
the 141 boston squadron ( above , on remembrance day ) have to sit electronic lessons and exams to progress through their cadet career .
but they say that `` with limited funding and resources '' the squadron is struggling to provide the it equipment to help cadets with their exams .
the group have begun fundraising for the cause .

we 'd love to be able to have excellent training facilities that will provide and develop key skills and qualities that will stay with the cadets throughout their lives , they are the next generation ''
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: missing woman found safe and well
text: yesterday we mentioned that 37-year-old dawn peterson had gone missing from cleethorpes .
police say she 's been found safe and sound .

documents.title: former red arrow pilot donates suit to children in need
text: a former red arrows pilot is raising money for children in need by selling his ( ever so slightly stained ) red arrows flight suit .
mike ling mbe , says he left a pen in his pocket while washing the distinctive uniform but hopes to sell it to raise money for children in need .
author: William Wright
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: pain returns for children in need walkers
text: there have been tears , toil and more blisters than you could possibly imagine , but bbc radio lincolnshire 's breakfast show team are back on the viking way .
scott dalton , corazon garcia and rob makepeace had to pull out of the charity walk earlier in the week because of injuries .
but the 're now back on the trail , but it 's proving tough going .
the pain is coming back but our # vikingpudsey team are gritting their teeth
ya doing well
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: red arrows 'could be built abroad ' warning
text: a former defence minister says the raf 's aerobatic team , the red arrows , could be built abroad if the government does n't bring forward an order for replacement jets .
the red arrows are based at raf scampton , just north of lincoln .
kevan jones , a former labour defence minister , says if jobs at bae systems are n't protected , we could lose the capability to build the famous jets in the uk .
if that sovereign capability goes , that means either the red arrows goes altogether , or the future red arrows will either be flying italian , french or possibly south korean aircraft .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: army vans to protect christmas lights switch-on
text: army vans will be parked at several junctions around the edges of the lincoln christmas lights switch-on event tonight .
it 's part of a drive to improve security efforts called `` hostile vehicle mitigation measures '' .
an incident is not expected , but special measures are being enforced to protect against possible repeats of terror attacks seen around the world .
simon colborn of the city of lincoln council is in charge of security .
he says similar plans are happening around the country .

it 's just good responsible event planning , we 're doing the same at the christmas market , and anyone attending large events around the country will see a range of measures designed to prevent vehicles from entering an area where there 'll be pedestrians .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : today 's weather forecast
text: a cold but sunny day ahead .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Alina Jenkins
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning and welcome to friday 's live coverage
text: good morning on this frosty friday morning .
it 's harry here bringing you the latest news , sports , and weather updates throughout the day .
if you fancy getting in touch , feel free to .
you can send an email , or you can send us a message on facebook or on twitter .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: well that 's it from me today , we 'll be back tomorrow with the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the county as it happens .
for now i 'll leave you with five things we 've learned today :
have a good evening .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: this evening 's weather
text: a dry night with long clear periods and light winds .
turning cold with widespread frost .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: rubbish could produce enough electricity to power 80,000 homes
text: a £ 170m energy centre planned for immingham could produce enough electricity to power 80,000 homes .

plans for the north beck energy project between the port of immingham and stallingborough will be submitted to north east lincolnshire council in the new year and it 's hoped the project will be completed by 2021 .
around 350 jobs could be created during the construction phase and lead to 40 permanent jobs .
dried recycled waste , which would have gone to landfill will be used to generate electricity .
otherwise known as refuse derived fuel , the waste will come from both homes and businesses .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 1,000 space car park to open in lincoln tomorrow
text: tomorrow , just over a year after construction began , the new lincoln central car park will open .
it 's opening two months ahead of schedule to coincide with tomorrow 's christmas lights switch on .
the car park forms part of the council 's £ 30m transport hub which will also include a bus station .
author: William Wright
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: gritting expected across parts of the region tonight
text: temperatures are expected to dip down to freezing tonight with a widespread frost so gritting will take place on many of the region 's main roads .
hull city council will start gritting their primary roads from 19:00 tonight as will north lincolnshire council :
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: can you help find dawn peterson ?
text: there 's concern for a missing woman from cleethorpes who 's not been seen since last week .
dawn peterson , who 's 37 , was last seen in the town on 9 november 2017 .
police say she has health problems and needs medication which she does n't have with her .
she is thought to have about £ 30 in cash and possibly a bank card , but no mobile phone .
if you know where dawn is you are asked to call the 101 number .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pudsey goes viking : end of day six
text: the pudsey goes viking team has reached their destination for the day .
various members of staff along with scott dalton and corazon garcia have walked over 19 miles today from tealby .
tomorrow for their final day they 'll head to barton upon humber .
it 's all for their children in need challenge which sees them walk 147 miles of the viking way .
if you want to find out more about the challenge for children in need and how to donate all the information is on the bbc radio lincolnshire website .
day 6 done !
tomorrow @ twitterid and @ twitterid are determined to do the 15 miles to get to the finish .
anyone who can meet @ twitterid at the end to cheer them home- get there ! ! ! !
# vikingpudsey
well done to you all .
the end is in sight now just try and enjoy it tomorrow # vikingpudsey
go team # vikingpudsey we have loved the coverage this week , will be a bit sad when it ends !
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: man in court over rape allegations
text: a man charged with raping two teenagers in derbyshire has appeared in court .
john storer , from mablethorpe in lincolnshire , is accused of raping two 17-year-old girls - one in 1975 in littleover and in 1984 in allestree .
the 76-year-old has been released on police bail and will appear at derby crown court on 14 december .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: siemens announces 7,000 job cuts - most in germany
text: the german-based energy manufacturing company siemens , which employs more than 1,500 people in lincolnshire , has announced large job losses .
but the county is not expected to bear the brunt of the cuts .
making this announcement today , siemens says that the renewable sector is putting pressure on traditional fossil power generation industry .
just under 7,000 jobs are to go - most of them in germany .
the job losses are in the sectors making large turbines , here in lincolnshire siemens makes smaller and medium-sized ones .
the company has invested heavily in new machinery and offices and also in the school of engineering at the university of lincoln .
more details are expected to be announced in due course .
author: Sharon Edwards
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: owls flourish in lincolnshire despite national decline
text: conservationists in lincolnshire are hoping to retain the county 's status as the best place in the country to see barn owls .
nationally , the owl population is in rapid and worrying decline : there are just 9,000 breeding pairs left and 900 of these are in lincolnshire .
author: Laura Foster
BBC Look North

documents.title: catalytic converters stolen from van
text: investigations are under way after parts from a mercedes van were stolen in a burglary at a business on belton road in the isle of axholme .
it 's thought someone broke into the business before removing two catalytic converters .
police are appealing for witnesses .
author: Caroline Brockelbank
BBC Local Live
